summary: G. Robert Blakey was involved with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is the sender of a letter to Scott Breckinridge at the CIA requesting assistance in arranging interviews in Mexico with individuals like June Cobb Sharp and Henry P. Lopez. The letter indicates the sensitive nature of the information and suggests classification. Blakey's involvement is documented in July 1978. He also oversaw the payroll for the Select Committee on Assassinations, as evidenced by a certification report from March 1979.
significance: As the sender of a letter requesting CIA assistance for interviews related to the JFK assassination investigation, G. Robert Blakey played a role in the HSCA's efforts to gather information and investigate potential leads in Mexico. His correspondence highlights the sensitive nature of the investigation and the need for cooperation with intelligence agencies.
